definition: to compose a poem (to a given tune)
to fill or stuff/(of a form etc) to fill in
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Activity2: Listen to the tape and fill in the blanks.
sentences.chinese: 通过听短文填词，进行有目的的听力训练。

sentences.english: Only by one of our own music, lyrics of the song?
sentences.chinese: 一首仅能由我们自己谱曲，填词的歌？

sentences.english: Lyrics for Where We Are Now By Vanna.
sentences.chinese: 填词万纳现在我们是由。

sentences.english: Miao Zhen begin to give these two songs to sing part of the lyrics and recorded.
sentences.chinese: 苗振中就开始给这两首歌填词和录制唱的部分。

sentences.english: Or “The New York Times” crossword puzzle?
sentences.chinese: 或者《纽约时报》填词游戏？

sentences.english: The names of the tunes to which melody are composed.
sentences.chinese: 填词制谱用的曲调调名的统称。

definition: to compose a piece of music
sung performance/to sing for an audience
names of the tunes to which 詞|词[ci2] poems are composed
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
Vincent Fang (1969-), Taiwanese multi-Golden Melody Award lyricist
